original_title: Debate grows over college students carrying Narcan kits on campus | Fox News
article_summary: College parents are sending Narcan, a medication used to reverse opioid overdoses, to their children for back-to-school preparation. However, there's a debate about the potential risks of students administering Narcan, as many may not know how to use it effectively. Some universities have 'good samaritan policies' to protect students who intervene in drug overdose situations. The panelists emphasized the high stakes of the opioid crisis and the importance of education and prevention.</s>
